Topic.Title: write business insider, tell them to cover yhoo technologica screw ups mssg boards

Message.Msg: most mssg boards I've tried either don't come up (error message) --Error while retrieving the data (Error Code: MBHo_BOARD_NOT_FOUND)-- Or they come up with most of the posts missing e.g., the UNG board (sometimes one or two posts, sometimes posts up to the 18th) Intermittent can't click on posts (error message) Trying to post in many boards U get "failed to post" message Boards have not been working rite for quite some time. Many attempts to post failed without even an error message, hit submit and post vanished into thin air. Inconsistent policies one day you can post links the next you can't. One day they are deleting abusive posts, the next day they are not. Many over the top abusive posts running rampant while innocuous posts filtered out / vanishing. Filters that change many words into "#$%*" or some such symbol obviously detected as profanity - but actually things like #$%$, as in Bachelor of Science. On and On. a total and complete mess. No way to develop work arounds because the problems just keep changing. And never any presence of Yahoo, keeping users in the loop as to the vision and status of plan for the boards. The one positive is they've cut down on spam and abusive posts are slightly fewer.

Message.Title: Best trades of 2012 - Yahoo!
Message.Msg: Year-to-Date: Up 21 Percent Now for the best trades of 2012. With Marissa Meyer at the helm — a new CEO with a Google pedigree — Yahoo saw its stock price run up to its highest level in four years. Some have questioned whether the positive sentiment is justified, but so far Meyer has upped spending on advertising and quickly closed the nearly $8 billion Alibaba deal, all while improving employee morale. For now, Wall Street is willing to give Meyer the benefit of the doubt. http://www.cnbc.com/id/100333015/page/7

Topic.Title: Yahoo Updates Message Board Format

Message.Msg: I've been a basher of yahoo in the past 6 months. I didn't like what they did to product lines including message board. i like what I see today. i think no live links is to prevent spam and I'm sure there are clever ways to get around it on a post. The live edit is interesting concept, while popular in more specialized boards (specific sports message boards etc), but in loosely controlled environment with no moderators to make sure people don't get out of line, letting someone edit their posts just seem to be a frivolous option IMHO. And lastly, their user database must be huge, so allowing editing might be more of a technical issue.

Topic.Title: buyout

Message.Msg: The CEO isn't worth diddly in a buyout and even if you say she's worth $120M, that's only .10 to the share price. How do you get $30? I'll give a rough ballpark...$6.4B(was $8.4 but Uncle Sam gets $2B) cash, another $1B in accounts receivables, short-term investment account etc., $7.5B in Yahoo Japan gives us say $5B after-taxes, AG stake that 10% is gone at IPO so lets say $70B so $7B gives us say $5B. We're at 17.4B cash let's say $17.5B as you'd have slightly more in Yahoo Japan in my example. $17.5B plus that last AG stake let's say for arguments sake is $150B company so $13B after-tax. $30B cash/1.2B is $25 per share. Is the core worth $5 per share or $6B? That number rises with most of that money off-shore and subject to repatriation. I'm being generous on what AG IPO's at and what that last stake is worth. A likely offer would be towards the $25 so that way an acquirer has room to work with and a chance to get a return on their investment...MSFT firing everybody, doubling net income, gives them $10 per share of return IMO as an example.

Message.Title: a poem about Yahoo's Obama
Message.Msg: " The Yahoo / Obama Prayer " Obama is my shepherd I shall not think He makes me lie down instead of work He leads me to welfare offices He restoreth my unemployment He leads me in paths of bureaucracy For his name’s sake. Even though I walk through the valley of the shadow of factories I will fear no job For you are with me Your ACLU and the union They protect me. You prepare a table before me; In the presence of the working saps; You refill my WIC card for free My beer overflows. Surely welfare and handouts shall follow me All the days of my life. And I shall vote for the house of Democrats Forever.

Message.Msg: March 20th. After a ~50% retraction of the recent run up - to about $17.50. Then a steady climb north. Depending, of course, on what the broader market does. Yeah, I know. I'm an alias. I'm a basher. How dare I doubt Yahoo will hit $176 by the end of the year... blah, blah, blah.

Topic.Title: Pick the date that Yahoo will hit $20

Message.Msg: Oh, I am short - never tried to hide it. I put my money where my mouth is - otherwise what would I be doing here? I assume most people on the board are long, and a couple (like me) are short. No specific timeline, but shorting is an inherently risky position and should be done in short increments. But I'm generally bearish on the market, as well.
